intro: Adenocalymma nitidum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Adenocalymma nitidum is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
